intro: Lippia bazeiana, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to warm, arid climates. Lippia bazeiana is also valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
